Filter Top Impact Data

Source: R/plot.R
dot-filter_top_impact.Rd

This internal function filters the top top_impact observations within each group in the dataset, selecting an equal number of positive and negative impact values when possible.

Usage

.filter_top_impact(data, top_impact, group_col)

Arguments

data

A data frame or a list of data frames containing the dataset to be filtered.

top_impact

A numeric value indicating the number of top impact factors to retain. If NULL, all data is returned.

group_col

A character string specifying the column to group by when filtering top impacts.

Value

A filtered data frame (or a list of data frames if data is a list), containing only the top top_impact observations for each group.

Details

  • The function works on both data frames and lists of data frames.

  • It ensures that Value is numeric and checks for required columns.

  • The function groups data by Experiment, Variable, Unit, and group_col.

  • It selects the top positive and negative values separately, maintaining balance.

  • If an insufficient number of negative (or positive) values exist, the remaining quota is filled with the other category.

  • The final dataset is sorted by Experiment, Variable, Unit, group_col, and Value.
